history.content:
https://math.berkeley.edu/programs/undergraduate/advising

Looks like all the math department staff is on floor 9 in Evans. Maybe a Math Undergraduate Advisor is a good place to start?

----------------

OP here. I emailed the Math department advisers about this. Their response basically amounted to "be patient, keep an eye out for open spots- we will see what we can do". It's definitely not an issue of space- there are 425 seats in 2050 VLSB compared to the class capacity of 325. I think the reason why there's no waitlist for 110 (or any math class with discussion for that matter) is because they also ran into enrollment issues with kids getting stuck on the waitlist indefinitely while not knowing that their discussion was full.

https://math.berkeley.edu/programs/undergraduate/advising

Looks like all the math department staff is on floor 9 in Evans. Maybe a Math Undergraduate Advisor is a good place to start?

children.subject: To the original poster, did you get any updates about Math 110? It's full and has no waitlist...Will there be a waitlist?

history.content: Was wondering who to get in touch with regarding enrollment and class size of Math 110. With only 79 slots open as of Wednesday morning, it looks like it's going to fill up in Phase 1 before any rising sophomores have a shot at registering. Was wondering if anyone on this Piazza knew who to get in touch with in the Math department or has any info about whether the class will be expanded.
history.subject: Questions about Math department class size & enrollment questions?
